conversations.body_text: Hi Marcus Brooks,  Please connect the steering wheel’s USB plug to a USB 3.0 port on your computer. Using a USB 2.0 port may cause insufficient power supply.

Hi.

I have a brand new PC. This is my exact one and spec's - https://www.pcspecialist.co.uk/computers-for-next-day-delivery/1922/

I don't believe I have any USB 2.0 ports. I have the standard 4 in the motherboard and then a few blue and red ones.

What should I use?

Kind regards,

Marcus
________________________________

Hi Marcus Brooks,    If the issue only occurs with downshifting, it may be caused by a slight displacement of the microswitch, resulting in unstable gear engagement. We recommend pressing the button multiple times to check if it triggers correctly. If the test fails, try adjusting the screw slightly to move the microswitch upward to restore normal operation.

Please advise what screw. There is definitely and issue with the downshift engaging itself and disconnecting.

It makes binding almost impossible in some games and also making game play frustrating with random downshifts etc

Regards,

Marcus
________________________________

Hello. Please could you support?

Sent from my iPhone
Hi Marcus Brooks,  Simply move the microswitch upward, closer to the paddle, and then tighten the screws to resolve the issue.

So, loosen both screws and move it up?

I will try that.
Sent from my iPhone
Hi Marcus Brooks,  Yes, move the component to the position where the paddle can be fully triggered, then tighten the screws. This will resolve the issue.

Hi,

I have made the adjustments to the best of my ability, but I still have random down shots when driving. I was n a race earlier driving done a straight in 5th gear and then got a box of neutrals and could not select a gear. Race over.

I guess I just have a faulty button box of left shifter. Shame.

Marcus [image0.jpeg]

Sent from my iPhone
Hi Marcus Brooks,    We apologize for the delayed response. I will contact our support team to resolve this for you.
